w:r.w:t: Sort by priority number, followed by non-prioritized requests, followed by largest to smallest increases, then $0 changes, then largest to smallest decreases.
Item names in the table should match descriptions in the following paragraphs (change in CLIMBS to ensure all tables permanently use the correct item name).
Keep tables within the margins. The maximum table width is 7.0"
Indicate when a decision item requires legislation in the paragraph description.
Make sure tables include all fund source columns, including reappropriated funds.
If there are no notes after your table, use the "After Table Normal" style to achieve proper spacing.]
R3 State Demography Office (SDO) statistical analyst:
R4 Defense Counsel on First Appearance (DCFA) Grant Program reduction
[Insert table. Analysts can combine this with prior year legislation, if preferred.]
[Insert a short description of what the issue brief covers. This is what will appear in the briefing summary. Ideally, include the key takeaway or recommendation. Keep it to 1-3 sentences.]
[Add recommendation here. Omit if not relevant. If you don't have a recommendation, think about why you are writing the issue brief and try to include that key takeaway in the sections above.]
The General Assembly includes footnotes in the Long Bill to:
set forth purposes, conditions, or limitations;
This section discusses a subset of the footnotes relevant to the divisions covered in the briefing. For a full list of footnotes, see the end of each departmental section of the

Department of Local Affairs, Executive Director's Office, Moffat Tunnel Improvement District -- It is the General Assembly's intent that the Department continue its current practice of retaining lease payment revenues in the Moffat Tunnel Cash Fund and suspending distribution payments to Improvement District counties because this practice ensures that funds remain available to cover any potential Improvement District liabilities related to the Tunnel and any costs related to studies or other actions that need to occur prior to the expiration of the lease with Union Pacific Railroad in 2025 in order to protect the interests of the Improvement District and the State.

[Explain whether the department's actions comply with the footnote. If relevant, provide supporting information that compares the department's actions to the expectations in the footnote. Often, JBC members want to know who added a footnote and the reasons, to the extent legislators discussed those reasons publicly.]

Department of Local Affairs, Division of Housing -- It is the General Assembly's intent that the Department target state General Fund appropriations for affordable housing to projects and clients that can be reasonably expected to reduce other State costs. It is the General Assembly's further intent that the Department prioritize State-funded rental assistance for the following populations: Medicaid clients who are transitioning from a nursing home or long-term care facility; clients transitioning from a State Mental Health Institute or a State-funded behavioral healthcare facility; and clients transitioning from the Department of Corrections, the Division of Youth Services in Department of Human Services, or a county jail.
The Joint Budget Committee may submit requests for information (RFIs) to departments. The Joint Budget Committee must prioritize the requests per Section 2-3-203 (3), C.R.S.
This section discusses a subset of the RFIs relevant to the divisions covered in the briefing. For a full list of RFIs, see the
[Discuss RFIs affecting multiple or all departments here if applicable.]

Department of Local Affairs, Division of Housing, Community and Non-Profit Services, Community Services, Low Income Rental Subsidies -- The Department is requested to submit a report by December 1, 2020, that summarizes monthly expenditures of General Fund appropriations in FY 2019-20 for rental subsidies for the Colorado Choice Transitions (CCT) program. The report should include the following associated data for each month in FY 2019-20:
the number of CCT clients leased up with State-funded housing vouchers;
the number of CCT clients searching for housing with a State-funded voucher;
the number of CCT clients leased up with federally-funded vouchers or federally-
the number of CCT clients searching for housing with federally-funded resources.
by November 1 of each year. This report summarizes the Departmentâs performance plan and most recent performance evaluation. In addition, departments develop and submit a
to the Joint Budget Committee and the relevant Joint Committee of Reference by July 1 of each year.

, the Joint Budget Committee must consider performance plans submitted by departments and may prioritize budget requests intended to enhance productivity, improve efficiency, reduce costs, and eliminate waste. To find the performance plans, search the Office of State Planning and Budgeting website and select the

Appendix A details the actual expenditures for the last two state fiscal years, the appropriation for the current fiscal year, and the requested appropriation for next fiscal year. Appendix A organizes this information by line item and fund source.

[Do not delete this landing page. It is important for accessibility. Begin the numbers pages with A-2. Add the following note at the end of your Numbers Pages appendix through a text box in the PDF: "NOTE: An asterisk (*) indicates that the FY 2025-26 request for a line item is affected by one or more decision items."]
